findings.title: Ability to change the implementation of the wallet during the upgrade from v2 to v3
findings.description: The implementation of the wallet can be changed during the upgrade from v2 to v3.

findings.title: Possibility of DoS from the AvoVersionsRegistry contract
findings.description: Admin's controlled contract AvoVersionsRegistry can DoS all wallets using the calcFee function.

findings.title: One signer can takeover the multisig
findings.description: The owner of the multisig can add signers without updating requiredSigners, allowing a malicious signer to take over the multisig.

findings.title: State violation via call
findings.description: In function _executeActions() if operation is delegate call or flashloan callback, then contract at the end of function resets values for **_transientAllowHash** and **_transientId** to prevent reentrancy and further state violation. But there is possibility to change these variables in simple call.

findings.title: Violation of gas calculations in case of failed cast
findings.description: In AvoCore contract, immutable variables CAST_EVENTS_RESERVE_GAS and CAST_AUTHORIZED_RESERVE_GAS are used to estimate gas consumption on events emitting. But in case of failure, cost of CastFailed is dynamic and depends on variables revertReason_ and params_.metadata and could be more than 11_000 gas, because their size is not limited.

findings.title: Custom errors aren't decoded in proper way
findings.description: In AvoCore contract's _getRevertReasonFromReturnedData function, custom errors are not decoded properly when returnedData_.length > 68, leading to potential reverts.

findings.title: Possible function selector collision
findings.description: The use of delegatecall to a input-controlled function id can lead to possible function selector collision.

findings.title: A user can make AvoGasEstimationsHelper to estimate gas incorrectly
findings.description: A user can abuse tx.origin check in action.target to make AvoGasEstimationsHelper estimate gas incorrectly, potentially leading to underpayment of fees.

findings.title: Broadcaster can send the cast transaction with a lot more gas than the user instructed
findings.description: The relayer (AvoForwarder) can send a transaction with more gas than the user instructed minimum amount, causing the user to pay for gas fees exceeding their expectation.

findings.title: Possibility of DoS DepositManager
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Little gas optimizations
findings.description: Optimizations can be made to reduce gas consumption in functions isAllowedSigner_ and depositT.

findings.title: Unchecked delegatecall in upgradeToAndCall
findings.description: In function upgradeToAndCall() after changing implementation there is delegatecall to new implementation. This may lead to state violation and bypassing onlySelf modifier.

findings.title: Misleading name of parent contract of AvoFactory
findings.description: AvoFactory contract is inherited from AvoForwarderCore which leads to misleading with actual one in AvoForwarder.sol.

findings.title: Check for set value for avoWalletImpl and avoMultisigImpl variables
findings.description: The implementation variables avoWalletImpl and AvoMultisigImpl should be checked before deploying proxies.

findings.title: Old verify function could be marked as view
findings.description: Functions verifyV1, verify(), and verifyV2 are not marked as **view** because they potentially may deploy wallets. However, inside function _getDeployedLegacyAvoWallet() is called which just computes wallet address and checks if it is contract. So in old versions there is no deploy for wallet and they can be marked as **view**.

findings.title: Sanity check for feeConfig
findings.description: In function updateFeeConfig(), new config is set but it's not checked for correct values. When mode equals 0, then fee parameter is in percents and should be checked to be less than or equal 100% (10^8 in code).

findings.title: Outdated interface for IAvoWalletV2
findings.description: The current working version of AvoWallet is 2.0.1, but the interfaces section only has an interface for 2.0.0 which misses StorageSnapshot struct and has no castAuthorized() method.

findings.title: Too much gas providing for feeCollector
findings.description: Providing 22000 gas for transferring previously calculated **feeAmount** to **feeCollector**, but EVM automatically adds 2300 gas for simple transfer.

findings.title: Code duplication
findings.description: Pairs of functions that are identical in AvoMultisig and AvoWallet contracts.

findings.title: Variables can be made internal
findings.description: Global variables 'broadcasters' and 'auths' can be made internal instead of public because there are external functions 'isBroadcaster' and 'isAuth' that can be used to check values in those mappings.

findings.title: N/A
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Implicit conversion to address
findings.description: At AvoCore.sol#L79, sload(_avoImplementation.slot) takes the implementation address from slot 0 without explicit conversion using a bit mask.

findings.title: No revert message
findings.description: At AvoCore.sol#L496, there is no revert message in the _toHexDigit() function.

findings.title: Typos
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Magic numbers can be replaced with constant variables
findings.description: Variables should be declared as constants instead of magic numbers.

findings.title: Ownable contracts can renounce ownership
findings.description: The contract owner can renounce ownership which may lead to unintended consequences.
